intro: Alyxia subalpina, commonly known as the alpine alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent tube, attracting various pollinators. Alyxia subalpina is adapted to high-altitude environments, often thriving in rocky soils and exposed areas.
